alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 11 at 9:38PM MST until January 12 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ FRIDAY TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, northwest and west central Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM MST /9 AM CST/ Friday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ Friday to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Most of the expected cold wind chill readings for the Advisory/Warning periods will occur at night, but will linger into the daytime hours each day. Coldest readings will occur Saturday night into Sunday morning.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
